intro: Lappula platyptera, commonly known as broadleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Chenopodiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, broad, flat leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short, hairy pedicels. Lappula platyptera is often found in disturbed soils, such as along roadsides or in dry, open habitats. It is an annual or biennial plant that thrives in temperate climates.
